turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...this is magnificent.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...Stanley Moss...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: 8 days and we bring it back home....

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: None of these are ours.  <u>None</u> of em are ours....  ....that's <u>real politik</u>, Buddy.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Waal, I gotta tell you.  I've been inside the Beltway fourteen years, and I feel like I Just Got My Feet Wet.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...I just missed my plane.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: You missed your <u>plane</u>?  My <u>life</u> is over.  My <u>life</u> is over.  What have you <u>done</u> to me?  What have I done?  Fourteen years of Public Service...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, keep your <u>wits</u> about you, and let's see if we can't...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...fourteen years...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...brazen-it-through...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Brazen it through?  Brazen it <u>through</u>?  They're going to hang us out to dry like the <u>laundry</u> --- do you know what we've <u>ddd</u>...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: And I'd like to point out that I've been on prescription <u>medication</u>, the side-effects of which...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: I'm doing my job, Too.  Would you give me a... do you think you could call off your Dogs for a minute.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: No.  I was busy.  Yes, I need the new poll fig.... <u>how</u> long?  I'll call in from Nashville.  And patch me through to the Big Bird, will...?  I've got to <u>hand</u> it to you.  <u>They</u> sure let us out of there easy....

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...they just hadn't thought it through...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: He just got Hip to us.  He just ended the War.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: What are we gonna <u>do</u> about it...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: The War is Over.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Oh, God...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Yep.  Well, we started it, he Ended it...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Oh, Lord....

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...those limp-dick ... <u>turncoat</u>... I <u>thought</u> they let us out of there too easy.....

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: War's over, Pal.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Gloria -- sell the House.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: He thinks it's too...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: First of all, we're locked <u>in</u> to it, <u>secondly</u>:

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Ronnie says we don't need'em for another four days.  ...s'there a problem?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: No.  No...Pentagon says, Army's got'em, they got'm in ..."Custody"...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: How's your wife?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Pride of a job-well-done...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: It's the Pride of a Job Well Done, Stanley, yes, but it's <u>more</u> than that.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: That's not bad at all.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Well, you know, "The Whole Thing's Theatre..."

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Napoleon said, fellow won't sell you his life, but he will trade it to you for a little piece of ribbon.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...child at the airport...  breaks through the ranks, runs to "old shoe" -- should we have <u>flower</u> or a <u>bear</u>...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Uh...Didn't we <u>do</u> this?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Never quit a winner.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Wilfred.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...what have you <u>done</u> to me...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: All Combat takes place at night, in the Rain, and at the Junction of four Map Segments...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...what are we going to do...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Give'em another pill...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: No.  No.  He didn't mean anything by it at <u>all</u>...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Hello?   No, operator...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Courage, Mom.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Oh.  Hell.  And what do we do now?  What do we do <u>now</u>? Boy Producer?  Mister Win-an-Emmy, Social Conscience, <u>Whaleshit</u>, save- the-rainforest, Liberal hire-a-convict <u>shithead</u>? Mister Affirmative-Action Peacnik.  Commie... <u>shithead</u>....?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ... and he spent the last twelve years in a Milit&ry Prison...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: How do we explain <u>that</u>?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What about him?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Well, he doesn't have his Green Card.  He Doesn't have his Greencard.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ... you want Schumann saved by an Illegal Alien...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, what do you want to do about it?  What do you...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Stanley, you can't do this....

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Could we have you in here, please...7

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Oh, MiGod.

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: Guess who <u>I</u> am.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: I'd like to mention a few <u>names</u>, who...

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: I know who you are, Mr. Ames.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: I was acting as a Private Citizen.  Nothing that I've done should be construed as reflecting on the orders or intentions of anyone with whom you may have reason to believe I am connected with.  Or in whose <u>employ</u>...

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: Quite touching.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: And I take this <u>opportunity</u> to suggest that, equally, I admit to <u>nothing</u>, and that I would like my lawyer present.

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: Guess what?  We show, and N.S.A. confirms, there <u>are</u> no nuclear devices on the Canadian border.  There are no nuclear devices in Albania.  Z'at put us in something of a pickle?  Albania <u>has</u> no nuclear capacity.  Our spy satellites show "no secret terrorist camps" in The Albanian Hinterland.  The F.B.I. and the Border Patrol, And the R.C.M.P. report no repeat no untoward activity along our picturesque Canadian Border.  The Albanian Government is screaming its innocence, the world is listening.  There is no War.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: As are we all, and I'd like to take this opportunity to suggest that the Security of the country would be ill- served by any, any...any...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Any untoward "revelation" regarding, uh...

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: And I think that the Security of the Country would be best-served by its citizens obeying its laws.  Gemme a Federal Judge, gemme search-warrants, all premises controlled by our friends, and bench-warrants for the two of...

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: THE PLANE, IN A VIOLENT RAINSTORM, BUCKING WILDLY.  AMES, ON HIS KNEES, GATHERING UP THE PILLS, REPLACES THEM IN THE VIAL, SHAKES OUT TWO, AND GIVES THEM TO SCHUMANN.  WHO TAKES THEM.  MOSS THEN STRAPS HIMSELF BACK IN AND BREAN CONTINUES TALKING ON THE TELEPHONE.

turns.speaker: SCHUMANN
turns.text: You gonna git me back tomorrow?  Cause they havin <u>beans</u> tomorrow...

turns.speaker: SCHUMANN
turns.text: "...where's my pill..."

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: THE GROUP WATCHING TELEVISION.

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: ON SCHUMANN, WHO HAS CONE TO THE BACK OF THE COUNTER, AND IS EMPTYING THE CANNISTERS.

turns.speaker: SCHUMANN
turns.text: Where's my pill...?

turns.speaker: SCHUMANN
turns.text: ...where is my pill?

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: ON THE MEN, IN THE ROOM, ARGUING ABOUT THE ILLEGAL ALIEN, SCHUMANN IN THE B.G.

turns.speaker: SCHUMANN
turns.text: WHERE'S MY FUCKING <u>PIIIILLLLLLL</u>...?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: The threat of Nuc1ear Terrorism has been quelled.  We are in <u>contaot</u> with the Albanian Premier, who assures me, and this government <u>credits</u> his assurances, that his country does not wish us ill, and <u>has</u> not.  That the threat which we perceived was not of his wish, or of his making.

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: CAIN, MOUTHING ALONG, WITH THE SPEECH, SHE LOOKS DOWN, AND WE SEE WRITTEN, ON HER COPY. of his making

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: AS WE LOOK UP, WE SEE THE PRESIDENT BITING HIS LIP, AND CONTINUING WITH THE SPEECH.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: From whence did it come?  Our information states it came from a small group of armed, dissidents.  Of Armed and Violent Dissidents...

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: ON CAIN, AS SHE LOOKS AROUND.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: But that group has been, in the main, subdued.  Now: How did we come by this information?  And.  Who subdued that group?

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: CAIN LOOKS DOWN AT HER SCRIPT.  SHRUGS, AND LOOKS UP.

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: ON THE PRESSCORP, THE REPORTERS, LISTENING WIDEMOUTHED, TO THE PRESIDENT'S SPEECH.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: It falls to me to <u>reveal</u> to you a <u>secret</u>.  To reveal the existence of a secret group of warriors. Men, yes, and <u>women</u>, trained and pledged their <u>strength</u>, their <u>skills</u>, and, if called upon, their <u>lives</u>, in the service of their fellow Americans. A group so secret, its very existence has been known to just a few, and known not by a Name, but by a Designation Number, Three-Oh-Three...

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: ...member of the group, was left behind what were, then, Enemy Lines.

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: ON LIZ, AS SHE WALKS THROUGH THE H.Q., ON A BOARD WE SEE "DAYS TILL ELECTION 6" AND % IN FAVOR 82%.  A HUGE TV SHOWS THE PRESIDENT.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: And I can only say, to those family members, <u>of</u> group 303, which members are, I know, as I speak, gathering to comfort you, the parents of the missing man, I can only say,

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: THE PRESIDENT, HOLDING THE PHOTOGRAPH

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Dashes and Dots.  And those dots spell out a message in the Morse Code. And that message is, "Courage, Mom..."  And he got the message through. "Courage.  Mom..."  Well, to the Family of William A. Schumann, to the Men and Women of Unit 303, to my fellow citizens <u>I</u> say "courage."  I have informed the Albanian government, and I inform <u>you</u>, that we will not rest until the safe return of Sergeant Schwn&nn.  I'm told his unit mates gave him the nickname, "Old Shoe."  Ladies and Gentleman, we will not <u>treat</u> him like an Old Shoe, we...

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: YOUNG PERSON'S APARTMENT, NIGHT.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: ...we will <u>not</u> be swayed, will, will not be <u>swayed</u> from <u>Every</u> effort to find <u>our</u> Old Shoe, our...

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: OVER A SLEEPING BREAN, STRETCHED OUT ON A POOLCHAIR, GRACE, THE SECRETARY, COMES OUT ON TO THE POOL AREA, HOLDING THE SHOT OF A SMALL, FOREIGN LOOKING CHILD, IN FRONT OF A PILE OF RUBBLE. SHE SHOWS IT TO MOSS.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...we own it?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: But, you know, <u>this</u> is the meeting, Ron?  You think about it.  <u>This</u> is the meeting.  This, here.  Schumann and us.  King Kong and the Trainers...this's it... What are you working on?

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: ON BREAN, WHO IS DOODLING.

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: THE CROWDS AT ANDREW'S AIRKORCE BASE, THE "OLD SHOE" BANNERS, THE "COURAGE, MOM," BANNERS.  THE STILL BAND.  A SHOT OF THE BANDMASTER, SURREPTITIOUSLY, GLANCING AT HIS WATCH.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: How's our friend?  What is he, "dead?"

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: This is nothing. ...piece of cake.  Y'know, producing is being a Samurai Warrior.  They pay you, day in, day out, for Years, so that, ONE DAY, when <u>called</u> upon, you can respond, your training At Its Peak, and save the day.

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: BREAN, SHAKING HIS HEAD.  IN THE B.G., MOSS, DRINKING. THE TV COMES TO LIFE.

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: ON BREAN AND MOSS, WHO WALK SCHUMANN ACROSS THE HIGHWAY. IN THE B.G. WE SEE AMES TALKING TO THE DRIVER OF THE HARVESTER, WHO IS A SMALL, HISPANIC MAN.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ..."down safely," crew perished in the Crash....

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: ON MOSS, AS HE WALKS THE GROGGY SCHUMANN TOWARD THE GAS STATION.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...how ya feeling, boy?

turns.speaker: ANGLE
turns.text: ON THE GAS STATION OWNER, WHO HAS RETREATED TO HIS COUNTER AND PRODUCES A SHOTGUN, AND STARTS TO LOAD IT.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Shoe, boy...?  You know, you were telling me you wanted Beans?  Remember, you were concerned about the Beans...?

turns.speaker: FAD KING
turns.text: I gotta get something, I gotta get ...shoes?  Ties? Hats...?  Good.  Good.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...what is this?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Would somebody wake me in five minutes?

turns.speaker: FAD KING
turns.text: Does it <u>have</u> to be Albania?  Because, lookit:  I can get my hands on a lot of walking-around-cash, I think, if it's <u>Italy</u>...Look at the tie-in here:  <u>The</u> <u>Boot</u>, "Givvem the <u>Boot</u>,"... If we were to go Wide with a <u>shoe</u> as the fad.  A "Shoe-fad"...  Here's what it offers us...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: We're locked into Albania.

turns.speaker: FAD KING
turns.text: Well, let's not be too sure, why is that?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: The President is going to declare War against Albania in a half an hour.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Hello...?

turns.speaker: FAD KING
turns.text: Yeah, I need a list, people in Military Special Pro...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Schumann. We're gonna go pick him up tonight.

turns.speaker: FAD KING
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Out in Oklahoma.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, c'n we get him back home?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Could if we had to.  Rather not.  Rough weather.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: We're due at Andrews.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well, I wouldn't go up in it, lest I had to...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Captain...  You wanna Take'er up...?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Heavy weather East of here.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Whaddaya think?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Six to five and pick'em...you wanna <u>chance</u> it...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Course there's a war.  I'm watching it on Television.

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: N'who might <u>you</u> be, when all's said and done?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: My name is Ronald Brean.

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: Who're you working for?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Nobody whose name you want me to say, Mr. Young, I promise you.

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: S'all very well, but when the Fit hits the Shan, somebody's going to have to Stay After School, and who do you 'spose that might be.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: S'only got to hold for another few days.

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: Well, I'm not interested in how long its "got to hold for."

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What <u>are</u> you interested in?

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: I'm interested in the Security of My Country, Mr. Brean.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, I'm sure that speaks very well of you and for your parents.  But if forced to choose between the security of the country and the security of your Job, which would you pick.  And, while you hesitate, permit me to suggest that they are one and the same.  Your country and your job.

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: I'm <u>doing</u> my job, Mr. Brean.  That's what you see me doing here.  What <u>is</u> it you thought <u>you</u> were doing?

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: What's on your mind?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: I have a question for you.

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: Ask it.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Why do people go to war?

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: Why do people go to war?

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: I'll play your silly game.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Why do they go to War?

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: To preserve their Way of Life.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Would you go to War to do that?

turns.speaker: MR. YOUNG
turns.text: I have.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, I have, too.  Would you do it <u>again</u>...?  In't that why you're here?  I guess <u>so</u>.  N'if you go to war again, who is it going to be against?  Your "ability to fight a Two-ocean War" against who?  Sweden and <u>Togo</u>? Who you sitting here to Go To War Against?  That time has <u>passed</u>.  It's <u>passed</u>.  It's <u>over</u>.  The War of the Future is <u>Nuclear Terrorism</u>.  It is and it will be against a Small Group of Dissidents who, unbeknownst, perhaps, to their own <u>governments</u>, have blah blah blah. And to go to <u>that</u> war, you've got to be <u>prepared</u>.  You have to be alert, and the <u>public</u> has to be alert. Cause that is the war of the <u>future</u>, and if you're not gearing up, to fight <u>that</u> war, <u>eventually</u> the axe will fall.  N'you're gonna be out in the street.  And you can call this a "drill," or you can call it "job security," or you can call it anything you like. But I got one for you:  you said, "Go to War to protect your Way of Life,"  well, Chuck, <u>this</u>  is your way of life.  Innit?  And if there ain't no war, you can punch out, go home, and take up Oil Painting.  And there <u>ain't</u> no war but ours.

turns.speaker: CAIN
turns.text: It can be documented that he displayed the...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: This ain't the illegal immigrant Nanny.

turns.speaker: CAIN
turns.text: There was a group of Girlscouts here from Indiana last month.  One of them expressed an interest in a Frederick Remington bust.  The president took her into the oval Office, for a period...

turns.speaker: CAIN
turns.text: ...why?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...you the Press Office?

turns.speaker: CAIN
turns.text: ...Yes.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Earn your money.  ...He's ill, the Plane is sick...

turns.speaker: CAIN
turns.text: ...Good...

turns.speaker: CAIN
turns.text: What's more interesting than boffing the girlscout?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, that's what we're <u>doing</u> here...

turns.speaker: CAIN
turns.text: Is there a press conference today?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What do <u>you</u> think?  What I need from you:  I need a base of operations.  Some place in the District.  I need some clean <u>money</u> ...

turns.speaker: CAIN
turns.text: But there isn't a B-2 bomber.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Where'd you go to school, Kid.  Wellesly?

turns.speaker: CAIN
turns.text: Dartmouth

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Then show a little spunk.  There <u>Is</u> no B-2 Bomber, General Scott, the best of your knowledge, is not in Seattle to talk with Boeing...

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: China.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: When's he coming back...?

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: Touchdown, Andrews, fourteen hundred, today.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Alright, now, here:  he stays on the ground in China til Tomorrow.

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: Trade Re1ations.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: You're goddamn right.  And it's got nothing to do with the B-2 Bomber.

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: There <u>is</u> no B-2 Bomber,

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: That's what I'm telling you.  The two things:  the two things:  Rare strain of flu, No Cause to Be Alarmed.  And the B-2 Bomber...  Clear me a space.  Get me a copy, go rob one, get it off the computer, Wash Post, N.Y. <u>TIMES</u>,

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: How much...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: And, to hold it together, I need two days.  There <u>is</u> no B-2 Bomber:  here's what you do ahout that:  whoever is leaking stuff to that geek at the Post, lets it slip, "Geez, I hope this doesn't screw up the B-2 Program..." "What B-2 Program, and why should it screw it up?"  "If the president moves to deploy the B-2 before it is fully tested."  "Deploy the B-2, <u>Why</u>?"  "In the Crisis."

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: We have some mutual friends in Washington.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: And you're here <u>why</u>...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: I'm here, Mr. Moss, because you've shown yourself a great supporter of the Party.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Party's gonna need more than a couple bucks now.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What one has to do, Mr. Moss.  Is to fight a holding action.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...holding action.  THEY'RE GOING TO TEAR THIS GUY TO <u>Shreds</u>.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: If we can hold the break-in-the-dam for ten days, til the election, we...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Yeah, hut you can't hold the dam.  How the hell, n'nu'n', I don't get what you want <u>me</u> to ...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What do you want the kid to say?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Have him say, 'I know we're all concerned for the President, there will he an update at 5:45.'

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: String a few together.  All I need's eleven,

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: How you going to stretch it?  This won't hold for eleven days.  Guy fucked a twelve- year-old...whadday're gonna do to hold that off?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What do you think would hold it off?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Uh, <u>nothing</u>, oh, <u>nothing</u> ... uh... a <u>War</u>, uh...  You're kidding.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I'm a Jew in Show Business.  Why come to me?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: I'm gonna <u>tell</u> you why...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Here's the Short Course:  Fifty-Four, Forty or Fight. What does <u>that</u> mean?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Uh, it's a slogan.  From, uh...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...uh ... No, that's...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: We remember the slogans, we can't even remember the fucking <u>wars</u>.  Y'know why.  Cause it's <u>show business</u>. That's why I'm here.  Naked girl, covered in Napalm. Five marines Raising the Flag, Mount Suribachi. Churchill, V for Victory, Y'remember the Picture, fifty years from now, they'll have forgotten  the war.  Gulf War?  Smart Bomb, falling through the roof.  2500 missions a day, 100 days, <u>One Shot</u> of One Bomb.  The American people bought that war. M'I getting through to you?  War in the Balkans, don't mean nothing, till some G.I. flyer, went down, Eating Snakes for Ten days. N'then It's show business, Mister Moss.  That's why I'm here.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: It's like being a producer, Mr. Moss.  The Things in Trouble.  Somebody's got to wade in, save the thing.  You get the Actors get up there, and strut and <u>Posture</u>.  But somebody, knows what's what, got to jump in and Save the Thing.

You watched the Gulf War.  What did you see?  Day after day, the one "Smart Bomb" falling into a building. The <u>truth</u>, I was in the building when they <u>shot</u> that shot, they shot it in a studio, Falls Church Virginia, 1/10th scale model of a building.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Is that true?

turns.text: I never won an Oscar.

Act <u>Two</u> ... the... uh...

We're, we're playing way <u>past</u> it, we're <u>past</u> it -- it's the set-up for...he has <u>got</u> to say the speech.  Tell Ames to meet me at the West Gate in...

turns.text: Mmm...

turns.text: ...that's right.

Because Schumann's the Shark.  He's ...<u>Jaws</u>.  You have to <u>tease</u>'em... You don't puttem in the first reel of the movie...  Bring'em back <u>slow</u>, the President...  No, no, put him on.  Put him on.  President wants to reveal Scbumann before the election.

Make... that's right, the price is their vote. Now, we bring him home, the President announces he is flying <u>home</u>, he's <u>here</u>, he's <u>there</u>... f'there the election, TA DA, here he is.  Have him say it like I wrote it, It'll be fine. Thanks.  Labor, five bucks an hour.  If you <u>watch</u>, <u>ten</u> bucks an hour.  If you <u>help</u> ... if you <u>help</u>, a <u>hundred</u> bucks an hour.

Air force jet lands, we take somebody <u>else</u> off <u>that</u> jet...what the fuck do <u>I</u> care? Somebody in a Hospital gown.  And we need a ......hello?  Hello...?

turns.speaker: MOSS
